intro: Leucopogon sparsus, commonly known as the slender leucopogon, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. This species is characterized by its narrow, linear leaves and small, white or pale pink flowers that appear in clusters. It typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in open woodlands or heathlands. The plant is well adapted to the dry and nutrient-poor environments of its native range.
